page.title: 04Farms In North Abingdon
page.content: It is really quite incredible to record the number of changes there have been in the farms of this area in the last forty years.In those days there were nearly twenty small farms,mostly dairy and all with very little mechanical equipment.The farms were much smaller than today's average of 700 acres.Ten years ago there were eleven farms.Today there are only four!The area farmed has decreased by 30% due to housing development,especially Peachcroft estate.Even this year another 100 acres is being built on for the new Long Furlong estate at Lodge Hill. The four remaining farms are Blagrove (600 acres),Peachcroft(835 acres) Starveal(little more than a small holding) and Dunmore Farm (300 acres)which is now up for sale.
